ground_truth: Inside, we see Vanessa sitting alone at her perfect dining room table, drinking a glass of wine. Vanessa takes a sip and continues to let the day's events sink in. After a beat, Mark comes down the stairs to join her. Mark nods and sits down. There's a loud knock on the front door. Mark opens the door. He squints and sees Juno pulling away in the van. He holds it up. We can see there's writing on the back. Vanessa takes the note from his hand and turns it over, examining it. A porch light's been left on for her, and the place looks cozy and inviting. Juno parks her car and walks up to her house. She picks a crocus from the unkempt garden near the porch and sniffs it. She lifts her shirt and tickles her belly with it. Mac is alone at the kitchen table going over the family finances while drinking one of Bren's weight loss shakes. Juno enters. A wave of realization crosses Juno's face. Juno presses Bleeker's hand against her belly. Juno lets out a genuine shriek of pain. The doctor reveals Juno's baby boy above the sheet. Juno looks at the baby in awe, then her eyes begin to flutter and she passes out. Paulie Bleeker is running as fast as his legs can carry him on the Dancing Elk track. There's a very sparse crowd in the bleachers. As Paulie approaches the tape, his envious teammate Vijay looks on. The fifteen or so people in attendance cheer. Paulie breaks the tape, winning the race. Bleeker looks out at the bleachers, scanning them for Juno. Bleek takes off running toward the parking lot without stopping to explain. The nurse turns and addresses an unseen spectator. A nurse reaches into one of the maternity ward bassinets and gently lifts up a swaddled newborn baby. It looks like it was handwritten on the back of a Jiffy Lube bill. We move to the door and get a view of Vanessa's bedroom. We see her lying in bed with a burp cloth draped over her shoulder, feeding the baby. For the first time ever, Vanessa looks disorganized, unshowered -- and incredibly happy. There are formula bottles on the bedside table and a bassinet pushed close to the bed. Obviously, she hasn't been away from the baby for a single moment. It's a sparkling summer afternoon. She waves goodbye to Bren, who is playing in the yard with two Weimaraners. She looks happy, but older. She looks almost as happy with her dogs as Vanessa looked with her baby. Juno wheels her bicycle out of the detached garage. She's obviously not pregnant anymore. Her guitar is slung over her shoulder in a gig bag.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: Inside, Vanessa is seen sitting alone at her perfect dining room table, with a glass of wine being drunk by her. A sip is taken by Vanessa, and she continues letting the day's events sink in. After a beat, the stairs are descended by Mark to join her. A nod is given by Mark, and he sits down. A loud knock is heard on the front door. The door is opened by Mark. Juno is seen pulling away in the van as he squints. It is held up by him, and we can see there’s writing on the back. The note is taken by Vanessa from his hand and is turned over by her, being examined. The porch light has been left on for her, and the place looks cozy and inviting. Juno parks her car and walks up to her house. A crocus is picked by her from the unkempt garden near the porch and sniffed. Her shirt is lifted, and her belly is tickled with it by her. Mac, alone at the kitchen table, goes over the family finances while a weight loss shake of Bren's is drunk by him. Juno enters, and a wave of realization crosses her face. Bleeker’s hand is pressed against her belly by Juno. A genuine shriek of pain is let out by Juno. Juno's baby boy is revealed by the doctor above the sheet. The baby is looked at in awe by Juno, then her eyes begin to flutter, and she passes out. Paulie Bleeker runs as fast as his legs can carry him on the Dancing Elk track. A very sparse crowd in the bleachers watches. As Paulie approaches the tape, his envious teammate Vijay looks on. The fifteen or so people in attendance cheer. The tape is broken by Paulie, and the race is won by him. The bleachers are looked out at by Bleeker, scanning them for Juno. Without stopping to explain, he runs toward the parking lot. An unseen spectator is addressed by the nurse as she turns. One of the maternity ward bassinets is reached into by a nurse, and a swaddled newborn baby is gently lifted up by her. It looks like someone handwrote it on the back of a Jiffy Lube bill. We move to the door and get a view of Vanessa's bedroom. We see her lying in bed, a burp cloth draped over her shoulder, and the baby fed by her. For the first time ever, Vanessa is looked at as disorganized, unshowered—and incredibly happy. Formula bottles are on the bedside table, and a bassinet is pushed close to the bed. Obviously, she hasn’t been away from the baby for a single moment. It’s a sparkling summer afternoon. Bren is waved goodbye to by her, who is playing in the yard with two Weimaraners. She is looked at as happy, but older. As happy with her dogs as Vanessa looked with her baby, she looks. Juno wheels her bicycle out of the detached garage. It’s obvious she is not pregnant anymore. Her guitar is slung over her shoulder in a gig bag.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: Inside, Vanessa sits alone at her dining table, sipping wine and reflecting on the day. Mark joins her, and they hear a loud knock at the door. Mark opens it to see Juno leaving in a van. He finds a note with writing on the back, which Vanessa examines. A light is left on, making the place look inviting. Juno parks her car, picks a crocus from the garden, and tickles her belly with it. Meanwhile, Mac reviews finances while drinking a weight loss shake. Juno enters, realizes something, and presses Bleeker's hand to her belly. She shrieks in pain as the doctor reveals her baby boy, then passes out. Paulie Bleeker runs on the track, with a sparse crowd watching. He wins the race and searches for Juno but runs toward the parking lot. A nurse lifts a newborn baby, handwritten info visible on a Jiffy Lube bill. In Vanessa's bedroom, she feeds the baby happily, a burp cloth over her shoulder. There are formula bottles on the bedside table. It's a summer afternoon, and she waves to Bren playing with Weimaraners. Juno, no longer pregnant, wheels her bicycle from the garage with a guitar over her shoulder.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Inside, Vanessa sits alone, sipping wine at her dining table, contemplating the day. Mark joins her after coming down the stairs. A loud knock interrupts; Mark answers the door and sees Juno leaving in a van. Vanessa examines the note Juno left. Juno parks at home, picks a crocus, tickles her belly, and enters, realizing something. Juno presses Bleeker's hand against her stomach, shrieks in pain as the doctor reveals her baby boy, then faints. Paulie Bleeker wins a race, scans the sparse crowd for Juno, then runs to the parking lot. A nurse lifts a newborn from a maternity ward bassinet. Vanessa, in her bedroom, feeds the baby, looking disorganized but happy. Formula bottles and a bassinet are nearby. It's a sparkling summer afternoon. Bren plays with dogs, while Juno, no longer pregnant, wheels her bike from the garage, guitar in tow.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description:
Inside the warmly lit and elegantly furnished dining room, we are presented with the sight of Vanessa seated in solitude at her impeccably arranged dining table, savoring a glass of fine wine. Vanessa takes a thoughtful sip, allowing the events of the day to permeate her thoughts and emotions. After a brief moment of contemplation, Mark descends the staircase to accompany her. Mark offers a nod of acknowledgment before taking a seat beside her. Suddenly, there is an unexpected, resounding knock at the front door that breaks the tranquility. Mark rises to answer, and as he opens the door, he squints into the distance, noticing Juno pulling away in her van. He holds up a piece of paper, and it becomes evident there is writing on its back. Vanessa takes the note from Mark's hand, meticulously examining it. A porch light remains illuminated for her, casting a cozy and inviting ambiance over the scene. 

Meanwhile, Juno parks her car and approaches her home. She pauses to pick a crocus from the untended, wild garden near the porch and brings it to her nose, inhaling its fragrance. Playfully, she lifts her shirt, teasing her belly with the delicate flower. Inside, Mac sits alone at the kitchen table, deeply engaged in managing the family finances, while sipping one of Bren's weight loss shakes. Juno enters the room, a wave of realization washing over her features. Gently, she presses Bleeker's hand against her belly, and an instinctive, genuine shriek of pain escapes her lips. The doctor, with a sense of calm and expertise, reveals Juno's baby boy above the medical sheet. Juno stares in awe at the newborn, her eyes filled with wonder, before gradually fluttering shut as she faints from exhaustion and emotion.

Elsewhere, Paulie Bleeker is seen sprinting with determination around the Dancing Elk track, his legs propelling him forward with all the speed he can muster. The bleachers are sparsely populated, yet the small crowd watches intently. As Paulie nears the finish line, his envious teammate Vijay observes with a mix of admiration and rivalry. The fifteen or so spectators in attendance erupt into cheers as Paulie triumphantly breaks the tape, securing his victory in the race. Bleeker's gaze sweeps over the crowd in the bleachers, searching intently for Juno among the faces. Without missing a beat, he takes off running toward the parking lot, not pausing to explain his hasty departure.

In a quieter corner of the world, a nurse softly addresses an unseen onlooker. With gentle hands, the nurse reaches into one of the bassinets in the maternity ward and carefully lifts a swaddled newborn baby, the tender scene akin to a handwritten note on the back of a Jiffy Lube bill. Our viewpoint shifts, revealing Vanessa's bedroom, where we find her lying in bed, a burp cloth casually draped over her shoulder as she feeds her baby. Remarkably, Vanessa appears uncharacteristically disheveled and unshowered, yet radiantly happy. The bedside table is cluttered with formula bottles, and a bassinet is conspicuously pulled close to the bed, indicating she hasn't left the baby's side even for a fleeting moment. It's a bright and sparkling summer afternoon when she waves goodbye to Bren, who is delightfully playing in the yard with two lively Weimaraners. She looks content, though noticeably older, and almost as blissful with her dogs as Vanessa appeared with her baby. Juno, no longer bearing signs of pregnancy, wheels her bicycle out of the detached garage, her guitar casually slung over her shoulder in a well-used gig bag, ready for whatever the day holds.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
Within the warmly lit and elegantly appointed dining room, we are graciously presented with the tranquil sight of Vanessa seated in solitude at her impeccably arranged dining table, savoring a glass of exquisite fine wine. Vanessa takes a slow, thoughtful sip, allowing the events and occurrences of the day to gradually permeate her thoughts and emotions. After a brief yet meaningful moment of contemplation, Mark gracefully descends the staircase to join her company. Mark offers a polite nod of acknowledgment before taking his place beside her. Suddenly, there is an unexpected and resounding knock at the front door, abruptly breaking the calm tranquility of the scene. Mark rises to his feet to answer, and as he opens the door, he squints into the distant horizon, noticing Juno pulling away in her van. He holds up a piece of paper in his hand, and it becomes immediately evident that there is writing visible on its reverse side. Vanessa takes the note from Mark's hand, meticulously examining it with care. A porch light remains illuminated for her, casting a cozy and inviting ambiance over the entire scene, providing a soothing glow.

Meanwhile, Juno parks her car and approaches her home, taking her time. She pauses to pick a lovely crocus from the untended, wild garden near the welcoming porch and brings it to her nose, deeply inhaling its delightful fragrance. Playfully, she lifts her shirt and teases her belly with the delicate flower, a whimsical gesture. Inside the cozy home, Mac sits alone at the kitchen table, deeply engaged and absorbed in managing the family finances, all the while sipping one of Bren's weight loss shakes. Juno enters the room, a wave of realization washing over her features. Gently, with great care, she presses Bleeker's hand against her belly, and an instinctive, genuine shriek of pain escapes her lips, echoing in the room. The doctor, with a sense of calm professionalism and expertise, reveals Juno's beautiful baby boy above the raised medical sheet. Juno stares in utter awe at the newborn, her eyes wide with wonder and amazement, before they gradually flutter shut as she faints from sheer exhaustion and overwhelming emotion.

Elsewhere, in another part of town, Paulie Bleeker is seen sprinting with determination and zeal around the Dancing Elk track, his legs propelling him forward with all the speed he can possibly muster. The bleachers, though sparsely populated, are filled with a small crowd watching intently. As Paulie nears the finish line, his envious teammate Vijay observes with a mix of admiration and underlying rivalry. The fifteen or so spectators in attendance erupt into enthusiastic cheers as Paulie triumphantly breaks the tape, securing his glorious victory in the race. Bleeker's gaze sweeps over the small crowd in the bleachers, searching intently and hopefully for Juno among the faces. Without missing a beat or pausing for explanation, he takes off running toward the parking lot, not stopping to explain his hasty departure, his mind set on finding her.

In a quieter, more serene corner of the world, a nurse softly addresses an unseen onlooker. With gentle hands and a tender touch, the nurse reaches into one of the bassinets in the maternity ward and carefully lifts a swaddled newborn baby, the tender and touching scene akin to a handwritten note on the back of a Jiffy Lube bill. Our viewpoint shifts, revealing Vanessa's inviting bedroom, where we find her lying comfortably in bed, a burp cloth casually draped over her shoulder as she feeds her baby. Remarkably, Vanessa appears uncharacteristically disheveled and unshowered, yet she radiates a sense of profound happiness. The bedside table is cluttered with numerous formula bottles, and a bassinet is conspicuously pulled close to the bed, indicating she hasn't left the baby's side even for a fleeting moment. It is a bright and sparkling summer afternoon when she waves goodbye to Bren, who is delightfully playing in the yard with two lively and energetic Weimaraners. She looks content, though noticeably older, and almost as blissful with her dogs as Vanessa appeared with her precious baby. Juno, no longer bearing signs of pregnancy, wheels her bicycle out of the detached garage, her beloved guitar casually slung over her shoulder in a well-used gig bag, ready and eager for whatever the day holds and promises.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: Inside the warm confines of her dining room, Vanessa is seated alone at her pristine dining room table, savoring the taste of her wine. She lifts the glass to her lips, taking a measured sip, as she allows the events of the day to slowly settle upon her mind. After a moment of contemplation, her solitude is broken when Mark descends the staircase to join her. He acknowledges her presence with a nod, then finds his place at the table beside her. Their quiet moment is suddenly interrupted by a loud, resonant knock upon the front door. Mark rises from his seat, crosses the room with purpose, and opens the door. As he peers outside, his eyes narrow against the light, spotting Juno in the midst of pulling away in her van. She holds something in her hand, raising it as a sign. Mark takes the offered note, noticing the writing scrawled across its back. Vanessa reaches for the note, her fingers gently taking it from Mark's hand as she flips it over to examine the message. At Juno's house, the porch light glows warmly, casting an inviting aura over the homely setting, which looks comfortable and ready to welcome her. Juno parks her car nearby, steps out, and strolls leisurely toward her front door. Her eyes catch sight of a crocus in her untamed garden near the porch, which she bends down to pluck and inhale its fragrance. She playfully lifts her shirt, using the flower to tickle her own belly, indulging in a brief moment of childlike delight. Meanwhile, Mac is seated alone at the kitchen table, diligently reviewing the household finances while sipping on one of Bren's weight loss shakes. The door opens as Juno enters, and a wave of realization washes over her face, a moment of clarity dawning upon her. She takes Bleeker's hand, guiding it to rest against her belly to share this intimate understanding. Suddenly, Juno emits a genuine shriek of pain as the doctor gently lifts her newborn baby boy above the sheet for her to see. Awestruck, Juno's eyes are glued to her baby, but as the overwhelming emotions take hold, her eyelids flutter and she loses consciousness. Meanwhile, Paulie Bleeker propels himself forward with all his might along the Dancing Elk track, his legs moving with determined urgency. The stands are sparsely populated, yet as Paulie nears the finish line, his rival Vijay observes with envy. About fifteen spectators cheer from the bleachers, their voices joining in celebration as Paulie breaks through the tape to claim victory in the race. Yet, despite his triumph, Bleeker's gaze is restless, searching the crowd for a glimpse of Juno. Without missing a beat, Bleek dashes toward the parking lot, his eagerness leaving no room for explanation. In the maternity ward, a nurse gently reaches into one of the bassinets, carefully cradling a swaddled newborn baby. The note, appearing as though it was handwritten on the back of a Jiffy Lube bill, transitions us to Vanessa’s bedroom door. The scene shifts to reveal Vanessa lying in bed, her shoulder bearing a burp cloth, as she tenderly feeds the baby. Her appearance is uncharacteristically disheveled and unshowered, yet her face radiates an unparalleled happiness. Nearby, formula bottles rest on the bedside table, and a bassinet is tucked close to the bed, a testament to the fact that she hasn't parted from her baby even for a moment. As the sparkling summer afternoon envelops the scene outside, Vanessa waves goodbye with a contented hand to Bren, who joyfully frolics in the yard alongside two spirited Weimaraners. Vanessa's expression is one of serene happiness, marked by the passage of time, as she appears almost as blissful with her dogs as Vanessa was with her baby. Juno then emerges, wheeling her bicycle out from the detached garage, evidently no longer carrying the weight of pregnancy. Her guitar, encased in a gig bag, rests slung over her shoulder, signaling her readiness to embrace the next chapter of her life.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: Vanessa sits alone at her immaculate dining room table with a glass of wine, reflecting on her day. Mark joins her after coming downstairs, and a loud knock interrupts their moment. Answering the door, Mark sees Juno driving away in a van, leaving behind a note, which Vanessa inspects. The scene shifts to Juno arriving home, where she picks a crocus from her garden, playfully tickles her belly with it, and enters her house. Inside, Mac sits at the kitchen table reviewing family finances with a weight loss shake, as Juno realizes something significant and presses Bleeker's hand to her belly. In the maternity ward, Juno shrieks in pain as the doctor presents her newborn baby boy, and she faints in awe. Concurrently, Paulie Bleeker races on the Dancing Elk track, winning amidst a sparse but cheering crowd, before urgently heading toward the parking lot, scanning for Juno. In a tender moment, a nurse gently lifts a swaddled newborn from a bassinet. Meanwhile, Vanessa lies in bed disheveled yet blissful, feeding her baby surrounded by formula bottles and a nearby bassinet, indicating her constant presence with the infant. On a sparkling summer afternoon, Juno, no longer pregnant, waves goodbye to Bren who plays with Weimaraners in the yard, displaying contentment and maturity. She wheels her bicycle from the garage, her guitar slung over her shoulder, ready to move forward.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: Inside Vanessa’s dining room, renowned for its exquisite craftsmanship by a local artisan, we see her sitting alone at her perfect dining room table, drinking a glass of wine from a vintage bottle known for its rich flavor. Vanessa takes a sip and continues to let the day's events sink in, reminiscent of the solitude she often seeks. After a beat, Mark, who has been working late at his office renowned for its architectural designs, comes down the stairs to join her. Mark nods and sits down. There's a loud knock on the front door, echoing through the quiet evening. Mark opens the door, which creaks slightly due to the old hinges. He squints and sees Juno pulling away in the van, a vehicle she borrowed from her eclectic artist friend known for his colorful paintings. He holds it up. We can see there's writing on the back, hastily scribbled as if in a rush. Vanessa takes the note from his hand and turns it over, examining it carefully as the porch light, installed by Mark during a weekend DIY project, casts a warm glow, making the place look cozy and inviting. Juno parks her car and walks up to her house, a small but charming bungalow inherited from her grandmother. She picks a crocus from the unkempt garden near the porch, a reminder of her late mother’s favorite flowers, and sniffs it. She lifts her shirt and tickles her belly with it. Inside, Mac is alone at the kitchen table going over the family finances, meticulously organized in a spreadsheet, while drinking one of Bren's weight loss shakes advertised by a famous fitness guru. Juno enters, a wave of realization crosses her face as she notices the familiar setting. Juno presses Bleeker's hand, the one that has always comforted her, against her belly. Juno lets out a genuine shriek of pain, echoing down the hospital corridor. The doctor, renowned for his gentle bedside manner, reveals Juno's baby boy above the sheet. Juno looks at the baby in awe, then her eyes begin to flutter and she passes out due to exhaustion and overwhelming emotion. Paulie Bleeker is running as fast as his legs can carry him on the Dancing Elk track, a course celebrated for its challenging curves. There's a very sparse crowd in the bleachers, mostly local supporters. As Paulie approaches the tape, his envious teammate Vijay, known for his competitive spirit, looks on. The fifteen or so people in attendance cheer, their voices carrying across the field. Paulie breaks the tape, winning the race with a burst of determination. Bleeker looks out at the bleachers, scanning them for Juno, hoping to catch a glimpse of her familiar face. Bleek takes off running toward the parking lot without stopping to explain, driven by urgency and excitement. The nurse turns and addresses an unseen spectator, likely a worried family member. A nurse reaches into one of the maternity ward bassinets, carefully lifting up a swaddled newborn baby, bringing a comforting assurance to the room. It looks like it was handwritten on the back of a Jiffy Lube bill, suggesting a hurried but heartfelt message. We move to the door and get a view of Vanessa's bedroom, softly lit by the evening sun. We see her lying in bed with a burp cloth draped over her shoulder, feeding the baby. For the first time ever, Vanessa looks disorganized, unshowered—yet incredibly happy, a stark contrast to her usual fastidious nature. There are formula bottles on the bedside table, evidence of the demanding but rewarding new routine, and a bassinet pushed close to the bed. Obviously, she hasn't been away from the baby for a single moment, basking in the joys of new motherhood. It's a sparkling summer afternoon, the air filled with the scent of freshly cut grass. She waves goodbye to Bren, who is playing in the yard with two Weimaraners, athletic dogs known for their energy and grace. She looks happy, but older, the years having added a richness to her life. She looks almost as happy with her dogs as Vanessa looked with her baby, an image of contentment. Juno wheels her bicycle out of the detached garage, its paint slightly chipped from years of use. She's obviously not pregnant anymore, her figure having returned to its lithe form. Her guitar, a cherished birthday gift from her father, is slung over her shoulder in a gig bag.

test_cases.name: Addition (~80%)
test_cases.description: Inside we see Vanessa sitting alone at her perfect dining room table drinking a glass of wine. Vanessa takes a sip and continues to let the day's events sink in. After a beat Mark comes down the stairs to join her. Mark nods and sits down. There is a loud knock on the front door. Mark opens the door. He squints and sees Juno pulling away in the van. He holds it up. We can see there is writing on the back. Vanessa takes the note from his hand and turns it over examining it. A porch light's been left on for her and the place looks cozy and inviting. Juno parks her car and walks up to her house. She picks a crocus from the unkempt garden near the porch and sniffs it. She lifts her shirt and tickles her belly with it. Mac is alone at the kitchen table going over the family finances while drinking. one of Bren's weight loss shakes. Juno enters. A wave of realization crosses Juno's face. Juno presses Bleeker's hand against her belly. Juno let us out a genuine shriek of pain. The doctor reveals Juno's baby boy above the sheet. Juno looks at the baby in awe. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. In a bustling marketplace in ancient Persia a cunning street thief navigates labyrinthine alleyways and vibrant bazaars. his calculated every move a daring escape from the everwatchful royal guards. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. then her eyes begin to flutter and she passes out. Paulie Bleeker is running as fast as his legs can carry him on the Dancing Elk track. There is a very sparse crowd in the bleachers. As Paulie approaches the tape his envious teammate Vijay looks on. The fifteen or so people in attendance cheer. Paulie breaks the tape winning the race. Bleeker looks out at the bleachers scanning them for Juno. Bleek takes off running toward the parking lot without stopping to explain. The nurse turns and addresses an unseen spectator. A nurse reaches into one of the maternity ward bassinets and gently lifts up a swaddled newborn baby. It looks like it was handwritten on the back of a Jiffy Lube bill. We move to the door and get a view of Vanessa's bedroom. We see her lying in bed with a burp cloth draped over her shoulder feeding the baby. For the first time ever Vanessa looks disorganized unshowered  and incredibly happy. There are formula bottles on the bedside table and a bassinet pushed close to the bed. Obviously she has not been away from the baby for a single moment. It is a sparkling summer afternoon. She waves goodbye to Bren who is playing in the yard with two Weimaraners. She looks happy but older. She looks almost as happy with her dogs as Vanessa looked with her baby. Juno wheels her bicycle out of the detached garage. She is obviously not pregnant anymore. Her guitar is slung over her shoulder in a gig bag.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Inside, we observe a panda lounging alone at its exquisite chessboard, sipping from a cup of lemonade. The panda takes a gulp and continues to ponder the day's mysteries. After a pause, a giraffe descends the elevator to accompany it. The giraffe grins and reclines. There's a booming whistle outside the cabin window. The giraffe slides open the window. It blinks and sees a rabbit leaping away on the skateboard. It lifts it upward. We notice there's graffiti on the underside. The panda removes the scroll from its paw and flips it around, inspecting it. A street lamp's been left ablaze for it, and the cavern appears warm and welcoming. The rabbit docks its motorbike and strolls up to its cottage. It plucks a daffodil from the overgrown yard by the fence and inhales it. It raises its hat and tickles its toe with it. A fox is isolated at the dining alcove reviewing the clan's budget while sipping one of Leo's protein shakes. The rabbit arrives. A burst of understanding floods the rabbit's expression. The rabbit presses Zeke's paw against its toe. The rabbit emits a genuine howl of laughter. The artist uncovers the rabbit's sculpture above the canvas. The rabbit gazes at the sculpture in wonder, then its eyes start to close and it dozes off. A peacock is sprinting as quickly as its wings can propel it on the Starlight Avenue. There's a very scattered audience on the cliffside. As the peacock nears the ribbon, its resentful partner Neil watches. The ten or so creatures in attendance clap. The peacock tears the ribbon, triumphing in the contest. Zeke glances at the cliffside, searching for the rabbit. Zeke dashes off toward the bus stop without pausing to elucidate. The librarian rotates and acknowledges an unseen patron. A librarian reaches into one of the nursery department's cribs and tenderly raises a bundled infant puppy. It appears handwritten on the flip side of an electricity bill. We transition to the threshold and glimpse the panda's library. We observe it reclining in the hammock with a bib draped over its fin, cradling the puppy. For the very first occasion, the panda appears haphazard, unbathed — and exceedingly content. There are milk cartons on the nightstand and a cradle nudged close to the hammock. Clearly, it hasn't been separated from the puppy for an instant. It's a shimmering spring dawn. It gestures farewell to Leo, who is frolicking in the meadow with two alpacas. It appears cheerful but aged. It appears nearly as joyful with its alpacas as the panda appeared with its puppy. The rabbit rolls its skateboard out of the attached barn. It's evidently not sculpting anymore. Its banjo is strapped over its fin in a carrying case.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Vanessa sits alone at her dining table, sipping wine and reflecting on the day. Mark joins her before answering a door knock, only to see Juno leaving in a van. Juno returns home, picking a crocus from her garden and tickling her belly. Meanwhile, Mac reviews family finances in the kitchen. Juno has a moment of realization, pressing Bleeker's hand to her belly before shrieking in pain. The doctor reveals Juno's baby boy, and she faints in awe. Paulie Bleeker races on the track, winning amid a sparse crowd. He searches the bleachers for Juno and runs to the parking lot. In the maternity ward, a nurse gently lifts Juno's newborn. Vanessa, in her disorganized yet blissfully happy state, feeds the baby in bed, surrounded by baby items. She hasn't left the baby's side. On a bright summer afternoon, Bren plays with two dogs, appearing content. Juno, no longer pregnant, wheels her bicycle out with her guitar.
